data.title: Job vacancy: BI Developer, Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, Sutton-in-Ashfield
images: https://static.trac.jobs/employer-badges/National Preceptorship for Nursing Interim Quality Mark_2023 (1).png
data.text:
Sherwood is nationally recognised as being an excellent place to work and deliver care. We are rightly proud of the 5,500 colleagues who work here and we are the Health Service Journal’s Trust of the Year in 2020.

The Care Quality Commission rated King’s Mill Hospital Outstanding and Newark, and Mansfield Community Hospitals Good. Overall we are rated Outstanding for care.

For the last three years, we have been ranked as the best NHS Trust to work for in the Midlands and in 2020 we were the third best Acute/Community NHS Trust in England.

Happy colleagues deliver better care. Our teams work in a supportive, inclusive environment, which nurtures wellbeing and has opportunities for development and progression. We do not just care for our patients, we also care for you.

We would love you to join us.

_______________________________________________________

Job overview

Join our friendly and motivated team at King’s Mill Hospital! We are looking to recruit a full-time BI Developer to join a dynamic and collaborative team.

We are seeking a highly skilled and inspired individual to join our Information Development Team. As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will play a pivotal role in the development and maintenance of the Trust’s Business Intelligence (BI) and dashboard reporting solutions. Your work will be crucial in transforming data into actionable insights, enabling key decision-makers to monitor performance, enhance service planning, and develop effective services critical to the health and well-being of the population.

We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented professional who is passionate about supporting the health and well-being of our community through innovative data solutions.

Main duties of the job

To understand the role in more detail, please refer to the attached job description and person specification.

Working for our organisation

Thank you for your interest in this role.

Sherwood is nationally recognised as being an excellent place to work and deliver care. We are rightly proud of the 5,500 colleagues who work here and we are the Health Service Journal’s Trust of the Year in 2020.

The Care Quality Commission rated King’s Mill Hospital Outstanding and Newark, and Mansfield Community Hospitals Good. Overall we are rated Outstanding for care.

For the last three years, we have been ranked as the best NHS Trust to work for in the Midlands and in 2020 we were the third best Acute/Community NHS Trust in England.

Happy colleagues deliver better care. Our teams work in a supportive, inclusive environment, which nurtures wellbeing and has opportunities for development and progression. We do not just care for our patients, we also care for you.

We would love you to join us.
